answerText: acetone [or propanone][10] Acetone is used as a solvent in this reaction, where its namesake reagent is composed of chromium trioxide and sulfuric acid. This reaction is commonly used to change alcohols to carboxylic acids or ketones.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | South Carolina and Carlton | 10 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This compound undergoes a condensation with citral to make a pseudoionone. For 10 points each: [10] Name this compound, the simplest ketone and major component of nail polish remover.
